p: You must be wondering why you haven't rec'd more letters. It's hard to explain to one who isn't along with us; but it's because of ruch or weariness or both - often unconvenience too. I've thought about you plenty, just the same.

We've had a very successful time. I wrote about the U. of W. Virginia. It was the same or better at Berea. At the dinner here last ngiht (Auditorium Hotel) everything was lovely. I wish you could have been there. But you'll be at better affairs with me.
This morning Sig is trying to see that Radio man. We'll probably get started for St. Louis by noon.

I know the tight place we're in - it's plenty tight. Of course we'll get through all right. Sig is willing ot do what can & must be done. we have something like $100 with us. Sig sent you $57 - want it?
How happy we can be with a reasonable amount of money! We're so fortunate I'm every way!
I'm a bit weary this morning too - have been for days, & so have Sig and Max.
